Package cs1302.game

Class MinesweeperGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs1302.game.MinesweeperGame
  • public class MinesweeperGame
extends java.lang.Object
    Object class that constructs a new Minesweeper Game setup with 5-10 rows and 5-10 col (columns) and a certain numberOfMines, all given by a seed file.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      MinesweeperGame​(java.util.Scanner stdIn, java.lang.String seedPath)
      Constructor method that creates a new MinesweeperGame.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MinesweeperGame

        public MinesweeperGame​(java.util.Scanner stdIn,
                       java.lang.String seedPath)
                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Constructor method that creates a new MinesweeperGame. Calls parseSeedFile to assign values to rows, col, and numberOfMines.
        Parameters:
        stdIn - Scanner with standard input, given by the driver class.
        seedPath - String that provides a path to a seed file.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if

    • Method Detail

      • parseSeedFile

        public void parseSeedFile​(java.util.Scanner seedScan)
        Reads the seedFile and parses values from the file to assign them to the seedNumbers ArrayList, assuming the file contains values. Values from seedNumbers are then assigned to rows, col, and numberOfMines, assuming seedNumbers contains the appropriate number of values. The program exits if the number of rows and/or columns is not between 5 and 10, or if the number of mines is greater than or equal to the number of squares.
        Parameters:
        seedScan - the scanner object containing the seedFile
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if seedNumbers does not contain the appropriate number of values

      • assignMines

        public void assignMines()
        Reads values from seedNumbers (after the values assigned to rows, col, and numberOfMines) and sets the index (given by the values) of isMine to true. Initializes markers with spaces (" "). The program exits if not enough mine locations are given by seedNumbers.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the mine location given by seedNumbers is not in range of the mine field.

      • play

        public void play()
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Called by the MinesweeperDriver class, which in turn calls printWelcome to print out the welcome message. Calls promptUser repeatedly until program exits from an excpetion, the game is won, or the game is lost.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the welcome.txt file is not found

      • printWelcome

        public void printWelcome()
                  throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Creates a File object from the welcome.txt file, which contains the welcome message. A Scanner object prints the welcome messgae from the File. Calls printMineField to first print the mine field.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - which is propogated to play if the welcome.txt file is not found

      • printMineField

        public void printMineField()
        Prints out the mine field to standard output using nested for loops. Loops as many times as there are rows and columns. The last row (containing the column numbers) is printed seperately, since it contains no "|" characters. Prints out the characters from the markers 2D Array within the field, with a space on either side of the character.

      • promptUser

        public void promptUser()
                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Called by the play method, prompts the user to make a play. Invalid command error given if the user plays anything (including an empty play) other than "r/reveal", "m/mark", "g/guess", "h/help", "q/quit", or "nofog", and the mine field is then printed with a new call to promptUser. If "r/reveal", "m/mark", or "g/guess" is played, the appropriate method is called with a Scanner containing the row and col number of the play passed into it. If "h/help" or "q/quit" is played, the appropriate method is called with no parameters passed into it.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the gamewon.txt or gameover.txt file is not found

      • reveal

        public void reveal​(java.util.Scanner commandScan)
            throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Called by promptUser if "r/reveal" is played. Checks if the index played (given by a row and column number) contains a mine. If the index of isMine is true, a mine has been revealed, the player loses, and the game exits. If the index is false, then getNumAdjMines is called to determine how many mines surround that index. The number returned by getNumAdjMines is printed in the mine field and the number of rounds increases by one. Invalid command error given if the player does not give a row and/or column number, or if the row and/or column is out of bounds, and the number of rounds does not increase. Checks to see if the player has won (if isWon returns true) and if so, player's score is calculated, the win message is displayed, and the game exits. If not, the mine field is printed and the game moves on.
        Parameters:
        commandScan - the scanner containing the row and column number given by the player.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the row and/or column number given is not in bounds
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the gamewon.txt or gameover.txt file is not found

      • mark

        public void mark​(java.util.Scanner commandScan)
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Called by promptUser if "m/mark" is played. Adds a flag ("F") to the index of markers given by the player and is printed to the mine field. The number of rounds increases by one. Inavlid command error given if the index given is out of bounds, or if a row and/or column number is not given, and the number of rounds does not change. Checks to see if the player has won (if isWon returns true) and if so, player's score is calculated, the win message is displayed, and the game exits. If not, the mine field is printed and the game moves on.
        Parameters:
        commandScan - the scanner containing the row and column number given by the player.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the row and/or column number given is out of bounds
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the gamewon.txt or gameover.txt file is not found.

      • guess

        public void guess​(java.util.Scanner commandScan)
        Called by promptUser if "g/guess" is played. Adds a "?" to the index of markers given by the player and is printed to the mine field, and the number of rounds played increases by one. Invalid command error given if the index given is out of bounds, or if a row and/or column number is not given, and the number of rounds does not increase.
        Parameters:
        commandScan - the scanner containing the row and column number given by the player
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the row and/or column number given is out of bounds

      • help

        public void help()
        Called by promptUser if "h/help" is played. Displays the list of valid commands the player can give (not including nofog). The number of rounds increases by one and the mine field is printed.

      • quit

        public void quit()
        Called by promptUser if "q/quit" is played. Displays a quit message and the game exits.

      • noFog

        public void noFog()
        Called by promptUser if "nofog" is played. Prints a "cheat" version of the mine field that indicates where the mines are located.

      • isWon

        public boolean isWon()
        Called each time reveal or mark is called to determine if the player has won. If all mine indexes have been marked with a flag ("F") AND all non-mine locations have been revealed, the player wins, and the method returns true, otherwise it returns false.
        Returns:
        true if mines have been marked with a flag and non-mine locations have been successfully revealed, otherwise returns false

      • printWin

        public void printWin()
              throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Called by reveal or mark if isWon returns true. Creates a File from the gamewon.txt file, which passes to a Scanner to be printed out. Prints out the player's score on the last line, then the game exits.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the gamewon.txt file is not found

      • printLoss

        public void printLoss()
               throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Called by reveal if the index given by the player contains a mine. Creates a File from the gameover.txt file, which passes to a Scanner to be printed out. Prints out the "game over" message then the game exits.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the gameover.txt file is not found
